title: Ticket #5181: JobRouter thinks Condor-CE job is sandbox when it adopts orphan
description:
It appears that, when adopting orphan jobs (i.e., reconnecting to jobs after the process is restarted), the job router will assume jobs with SUBMIT_Iwd are sandboxed.

However, this doesn't appear to be a safe assumption. I don't understand all the remapping rules, but it seems this is very common for remotely-submitted vanilla jobs (i.e., how HTCondor-CE works).

A better approach would be to add a "IsSandboxed" attribute to the routed job and look for that when reconnecting.
remarks:
2015-Jul-29 08:51:06 by bbockelm:
To test:
  • Submit a job remotely to a HTCondor-CE.
  • Wait for the job to be routed.
  • SIGTERM the job router process.
  • Wait for the job to be re-adopted by the job router and run to completion.

Without this patch, the JobRouter will attempt to transfer a sandbox after completion and error out. With this patch, the JobRouter will cleanup "normally".

The title of the ticket currently refers to PBS, but it seems to bite all HTCondor-CE instances. Will update accordingly.

2015-Aug-03 13:53:29 by jfrey:
Code Review

This fix looks good.

2015-Aug-20 11:50:55 by jfrey:
There is a workaround for this bug for people running older versions. They can add this line to all of their Job Router routes: 

Delete_SUBMIT_Iwd = true;
